title: Firefox Translation Icon Not Appearing for English Page
content:
Hello,

I‚Äôve noticed that Firefox does not show the translation icon in the toolbar for a webpage, even though the page is in English. When I manually go to "Application Menu" ‚Üí "Translate Page‚Ä¶", I receive the message: "Translation is not available for this page - Sorry, this language is not yet supported." However, if I click on "Change source language" and manually set it to English, the translation works correctly. It seems like Firefox is not detecting the language of the page automatically, and as a result, the translation feature does not appear unless I manually intervene. The issue occurred on this page: "https://mantisbt.org/docs/master/en-US/Developers_Guide/html-desktop/#dev.contrib.submit.before".

I also looked for a way to report this issue, but I only found a form for reporting incorrectly translated words here: "https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdoRWnsHX6vVnGIRyLi4Kl-p0GrmeVIioqWsTz3aVTRfLScng/viewform". There doesn't seem to be an option to report entire sites where the translation does not work at all.

I'm using: Firefox Desktop 138.0.4 (64 bit) on Windows 10 22H2. Thanks for your help.
creator: zio3d

title: How to get a refund from Airtel payment bank?
content: To get a refund from Airtel Payments Bank, you'll need to contact their customer support. You can call them at 121 or 09531-163911" or use the Airtel Thanks app to request a refund. Alternatively, you can visit the Airtel website and check their "Help" or "Support" section for guidance. Provide details like your phone number, the amount recharged, and the transaction date to facilitate the refund process.
creator: Rahul064315

title: How can I refund my Airtel wrong recharge?
content: To request a refund for a wrong recharge on Airtel, follow these steps: Contact Customer Support: Call Airtel customer care at 121 or 0953116-3911. * use the Airtel app for assistance.
